episodeTitle: Spandam's Scheme! The Day the Sea Train Shook
episodeTitleJapanese: スパンダムの陰謀！海列車が揺れた日
episodeTitleRomanized: Spandam no inbō! Umi ressha ga yureta hi
description: Following his defeat at the hands of Rob Lucci, Zoro is sent across Water 7. At Franky's base, Lucci demands the Pluton blueprints. The episode features a flashback to eight years ago, revealing how CP5 agent Spandam orchestrated a conspiracy to frame Tom, using battleships that Franky designed to attack the World Government's judicial ship, ultimately seeking to obtain the ancient weapon blueprints.

events.title: Zoro Defeated and Sent Flying by Lucci
events.description: Following his battle with Rob Lucci, Zoro is sent flying across Water 7 and crashes onto a building due to the rising water from the incoming Aqua Laguna. He gets up, angered by Lucci, and runs off seeking payback.
events.significance: Demonstrates Rob Lucci's overwhelming power and sets up the ongoing threat the CP9 poses to the Straw Hats.

events.title: Lucci Arrives at Franky House Remains
events.description: Rob Lucci arrives at Franky's base, examining the remains of Tom's Workers. He picks up a picture, noting how Franky holds countless memories from the past. Usopp observes in surprise while Franky demands Lucci leave.
events.significance: Sets up the confrontation between Lucci and Franky, with the Pluton blueprints as the central issue.

quotes.text: I won't leave until I get the blueprints for Pluton.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Lucci reveals his true objective in confronting Franky

events.title: Spandam's First Appearance
events.description: The episode flashes back to eight years ago, introducing Spandam, a CP5 agent who arrives at Water 7 to meet with Tom. Spandam claims he has been researching the history of Water 7 for a long time and is seeking the Pluton blueprints.
events.significance: Introduces a major antagonist and sets up the tragic backstory that shaped Franky and Iceburg. Spandam's schemes have far-reaching consequences for the entire Water 7 arc.

quotes.text: I've been researching the history of Water 7 for a long time.
quotes.speaker: Spandam
quotes.context: Spandam reveals his interest in Water 7's secrets to Tom

events.title: Five Elders Order Spandam to Obtain Pluton
events.description: A flashback reveals that Spandam received orders from the Five Elders to acquire the blueprints for Pluton, the ancient superweapon. This authorization came under the guise of combating piracy, though Spandam's true motivation is personal power.
events.significance: Reveals the World Government's interest in ancient weapons and establishes the high-level conspiracy surrounding Pluton. Shows the Five Elders' involvement in the search for ancient weapons.

events.title: Sea Train Puffing Tom Celebration
events.description: Eight years before the present, the people of Water 7 celebrate the successful completion and operation of the Sea Train Puffing Tom, which Tom and his crew built. Iceburg informs Kokoro that Tom is meeting with a World Government agent.
events.significance: Shows the successful completion of Tom's life work and sets up the tragic events that follow. The Sea Train represents Tom's redemption for building Gol D. Roger's ship.

events.title: Tom Reveals Pluton Blueprints to Apprentices
events.description: Tom retrieves the Pluton blueprints from a hidden safe and shows them to Iceburg and Franky. Both apprentices are shocked when they see the ancient weapon's plans. Tom expresses deep worry, stating it would be a nightmare if Pluton were ever built, especially now that the World Government knows about it.
events.significance: Major reveal of the Pluton blueprints, one of the central MacGuffins of the Water 7 arc. This moment sets in motion the events that will lead to Tom's downfall and Franky's eventual role as guardian of the blueprints.

quotes.text: It would be a nightmare if Pluton is built.
quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.context: Tom expressing his fear about the ancient weapon to his apprentices

events.title: Tom Entrusts Pluton Blueprints to Iceburg
events.description: Tom tells Iceburg and Franky he cannot keep the blueprints anymore. Iceburg agrees to take responsibility for guarding them, while Franky expresses interest in actually building Pluton. Iceburg immediately punches Franky, insisting the weapon should never be built.
events.significance: Critical transfer of the Pluton blueprints that will shape Iceburg and Franky's futures. This decision makes Iceburg a target for the World Government and CP9.

quotes.text: I cannot keep the blueprints anymore.
quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.context: Tom deciding to pass the Pluton blueprints to his apprentice Iceburg

quotes.speaker: Iceburg
quotes.context: Iceburg's response to Franky suggesting they build Pluton

events.title: Spandam's Conspiracy Against Tom Begins
events.description: Unable to obtain the Pluton blueprints through legal means, Spandam begins plotting to frame Tom. The episode reveals that Spandam will use Franky's Battle Franky ships to attack the World Government's judicial vessels, making it appear that Tom's Workers are responsible.
events.significance: Sets up the tragic climax of Tom's story and explains how Spandam manipulated events to try to obtain the blueprints. This conspiracy will result in Tom's execution.

events.title: Tom's Philosophy on Shipbuilding
events.description: Through the flashback, Tom's philosophy as a shipwright is revealed - his belief in the beauty of ships regardless of their master's intentions, and his pride in building Gol D. Roger's ship, the Oro Jackson. This philosophy would later deeply influence Franky.
events.significance: Establishes Tom's core beliefs that will become central to Franky's character development and his eventual decision to join the Straw Hats.

themes.description: The episode explores the weight of inheriting dangerous knowledge (Pluton blueprints) and the responsibility that comes with it. Tom must decide who can be trusted with this legacy.
themes.symbolism: The Pluton blueprints represent both immense power and immense danger, symbolizing how knowledge and craftsmanship can be used for good or evil.

themes.description: Tom's philosophy about taking pride in ships regardless of their use is contrasted with Iceburg's more practical concerns about the consequences of one's creations.
themes.symbolism: The Sea Train represents Tom's redemption and his positive legacy, while the Pluton blueprints represent the darker side of shipbuilding.

themes.description: Spandam's scheming reveals how the World Government operates through manipulation and deception to achieve its goals, even targeting innocent people.
themes.symbolism: Spandam represents the corrupt and ruthless nature of the World Government's intelligence agencies.

characterSpotlights.development: Spandam is introduced as a CP5 agent obsessed with obtaining the Pluton blueprints. His cunning and ruthless nature is established as he plots to frame Tom.
keyActions: Meets with Tom demanding the Pluton blueprints
Receives orders from the Five Elders
Begins conspiracy to frame Tom using Franky's ships
quotes: I've been researching the history of Water 7 for a long time.

characterSpotlights.development: Tom's character is deepened through his difficult decision to pass on the Pluton blueprints. His wisdom and concern for the future are highlighted, as well as his pride in the Sea Train.
keyActions: Expresses fear about Pluton being built
quotes: It would be a nightmare if Pluton is built.
I cannot keep the blueprints anymore.

characterSpotlights.development: Iceburg is shown as the more serious and responsible of Tom's two apprentices, immediately understanding the danger of Pluton and refusing to let it be built.
keyActions: Agrees to take custody of Pluton blueprints
Punches Franky for suggesting they build Pluton
Informs Kokoro about Tom's meeting with government agent

characterSpotlights.development: Young Franky's impulsive nature is shown as he expresses interest in building Pluton, not yet understanding the full implications. This sets up his future character growth.
keyActions: Suggests building Pluton (is punched by Iceburg for this)

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded the opening scene with Zoro being sent flying and landing in Water 7, adding more detail to show the effects of Aqua Laguna.
The anime added more visual detail to the Sea Train celebration scenes, showing more citizens of Water 7 enjoying the Puffing Tom.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of Spandam, who would go on to become a major antagonist in the Enies Lobby arc.
Episode 249 aired on November 13, 2005 in Japan with a TV rating of 11.7%, ranking 5th for that week.
This episode adapts portions of manga chapters 353-356, covering key moments from Tom's backstory and the Pluton blueprint revelation.
The episode was directed by Katsumi Tokoro with animation direction by Naoki Tate, who is known for his work on many key One Piece episodes.
Spandam is voiced by Masaya Onosaka in Japanese and Bob Carter in English. Onosaka is known for his versatile voice work in many anime series.
